title: Firefox crashing when switching input language
content:
Hello,

I've been having this problem recently on Windows 11 with Firefox, where switching my input language to japanese (ALT + SHIFT keys) causes the browser to crash immediately. This happens about half to one third of the times I do it. It didn't happen before and I'm rather confused.

Searching on Google brought up a few similar experiences, such as this one, but the suggested fix (switching intl.tsf.enable to false on the about:config page) didn't work for me.

Any help is appreciated! Thank you very much in advance üòä
creator: red.kyogre.shiny

title: Scam broswer extension add on!
content: There is a scam browser extension add-on here https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/user/19226846/ The OKX wallet shown here is a scam. I work at the original company. For some reason, Firefox refuses to list the real extension from OKX, but keeps letting scam extensions pop up. We have been trying to connect with someone at Firefox, but none of our business emails or customer support requests have been answered. We are frustrated and confused. 1. Real apps are not allowed. 2. Fake scam apps are listed 3 times a month. 3. No clear route of communication.

title: Signing in  to flickr
content:
I use the flickr website many times during the day without issue, unti now. When trying to login this time I get the message shown in the attached image. I have gone through all the usual procedures, clearing cookies etc, including starting Firefox in safe mode, but still the problem persists and I am now at a loss. As a test, I even installed the Chrome browser and I was able to log into flickr with no problem. I have a laptop running Window 11 and the latest Firefox and the problem is the same on that - no flickr login.

Thank you for your help

title: Images from canvas black or transparent: img.src = canvas.toDataURL(); // FF: 'image/jpeg'=black. Png,webp,default=transparent.
content:
I don't know if this ever worked in FF, since I've been on Chrome a while. I tried canvas.toBlob() in FF without a solution.

The behavior is the same whether the served image is jpg or webp. A Servlet delivers the image data, here in webp: 

          response.setHeader("Content-Type", "image/webp");

On page, I use a canvas thus => see '// FIREFOX' 

     var canvas = document.createElement( 'canvas' );      canvas.width = width;      canvas.height = avail_height;      var context = canvas.getContext( '2d' );      context.drawImage( imgsrc, 0, 0, width, avail_height);      context.lineWidth = 150; 
     // FIREFOX: canvas.toDataURL('image/jpeg')=black, png,webp,default=transparent      img.src = canvas.toDataURL('image/jpeg'); 
     img.onmousedown = disableDragging; // for FF      img.style.opacity = "1.0";      console.log('setImg ok');

Inspecting a black jpeg: 

        data:image/jpeg;base64,...

Thanks!
creator: phobrain

title: Passwords not syncing between devices
content:
I recently bought a new computer, and I'm trying to get everything transferred from my laptop to it. I have a Firefox account, am signed in on both devices, sync is turned on, and passwords are set to sync. I don't know how, but all of my passwords are on my new computer, but not on my laptop and I can't figure out how to get them back. Maybe I messed something up trying to get all of my tabs transferred? It wouldn't be a problem if I was completely done with my laptop, but I'm still going back and forth between the two.

Also, it seems that the passwords on my new computer aren't the most up to date, as I'm signed in to several websites on my laptop, that won't accept the passwords on my new computer.

I would really appreciate any help getting this all straightened out.
creator: legomaster65

title: Firefox browser hides Win10 toolbar
content:
Since the last 1-2 months, the latest Firefox browser updates have had this negative effect, that each time when I open the browser in full window, it hides the WIndows 10 toolbar. Normally toolbar comes back visible when I move the cursor to the area, but not now. I need to either click Win+T or to minimize the browser window and then to make it bigger again (full size). That's not the normal solution. Normal shouldn't hide the toolbar at all. This doesn't happen with other softwares, and my toolbar settings in Win10 are like they should be.

If this is a known Firefox bug, is there any change that it could be fixed for the next update? Or can I do something by self to fix it?

Thanks!

title: Firefox esr 115.26.0esr will not allow any download
content:
Firefox 115.26.0esr will not allow me to download any files without producing an error message that I need to download the native client so that it can start JDownloader. I managed to download from the link the error message gave but when clicking on install.bat, it says it can't find the path and then press any key, which I do then it closes that and nothing happens.

I was not able to download and reinstall Firefox by using Firefox as I got the same message. I downloaded via Chrome and then tried to reinstall Firefox 115.26.0esr. It installed fine, but when I go to download a video file I'm back to the same error message that I need to install the native client.

How do I break this error message cycle and get downloads to work again? PS: I am using Windows 7
creator: backstein
